DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine whether oral stimulation program effective improve oral feeding efficiency . The sample size estimate 74 preterm , randomize classification subject experimental control group .
DOC.brief_title: Effects Oral Stimulation Program Extreme Preterm Infants
DOC.detailed_description: Recent study suggest oral stimulation program apply preterm infant facilitate oral feeding progress , improve breastfeed rate preterm infant decrease length hospital stay . The objective study evaluate effect oral stimulation program performance feeding , length transition oral feeding , length hospital stay breastfeed rate upon discharge . Primarily , evaluate effect oral stimulation program performance feeding . All infant assess speech pathologist blind group randomization . Secondarily , observe length transition oral feed preterm infant , conduct medical team observe length hospital stay . Both group monitor assigned participate study hospital discharge . All statistical conduct use Statistical Package Social SciencesÂ® version 18.0 . The data analyze treatment group differences chi-square Fisher 's exact test categorical variable non-parametric test continuous variable .
